title: Drawing, "The Study of Czarina Alexandra Feodorovna", 1835
medium: Brush and watercolor, gouache, pen and ink on off- white wove paper
signed: Lower right, in white: Sotira/ 1835 [date effaced]
provenance: Eugene V. Thaw Collection; Popoff & Cie, Paris
dimensions:
Old frame H x W x D: 50.8 x 66.7 x 8.3 cm (20 x 26 1/4 x 3 1/4 in.)
Sheet: 27.4 x 40.7 cm (10 13/16 x 16 in.)
description: This view depicts a room with a coffered, barrel-vaulted ceiling and furniture in the Russian taste (1820-1830). On display are a large collection of paintings, two marble sculptures of the Crouching Venus flanking the window, and potted plants, urns and vases. The Czarina is seated at her writing table at the far end of the room.

exhibitions.title: House Proud: 19th Century Watercolor Interiors from the Thaw Collection
